data.enText: dimmer
dimmest
light
not bright
the dim glow of the fire in the grate
This light is too dim to read by.
place

data.chText: 不明亮的；光线暗淡的；昏暗的
data.enText: where you cannot see well because there is not much light
a dim room/street
shape

data.chText: 不分明的；不清楚的；朦胧的；隐约的
data.enText: that you cannot see well because there is not much light

data.chText: 月光下影影绰绰的房子的轮廓
data.enText: the dim outline of a house in the moonlight

data.chText: 我模模糊糊看见门口有个人影。
data.enText: I could see a dim shape in the doorway.
eyes

data.chText: 看不清的；视力差的；模糊的
data.enText: not able to see well
His eyesight is getting dim.
memories
that you cannot remember or imagine clearly
dim memories
She had a dim recollection of the visit.
in the dim and distant past
person
not intelligent
He's very dim.
situation
not giving any reason to have hope; not good
Her future career prospects look dim.

data.chText: 过了好一阵他的眼睛才适应了这昏暗的地方。
data.enText: It took a while for his eyes to adjust to the dimness.
take a dim view of sb/sth

data.chText: 对…持不赞成（或怀疑）态度；对…没有好感
data.enText: to disapprove of sb/sth; to not have a good opinion of sb/sth

data.chText: 她对我的建议持否定态度。
data.enText: She took a dim view of my suggestion.
light
if a light dims or if you dim it, it becomes or you make it less bright

data.chText: 幕布升起，剧场内的灯光暗了下来。
data.enText: The lights in the theatre dimmed as the curtain rose.
feeling/quality
if a feeling or quality dims , or if sth dims it, it becomes less strong

data.chText: 这些年来她对跳舞的热情一直不减。
data.enText: Her passion for dancing never dimmed over the years.

ex.chText: 这房间光线太暗，不能在这儿画画。
ex.enText: The room is too dark to paint a picture in.

ex.chText: 不要总是关注事物的阴暗面。
ex.enText: Don't always focus on the dark side of things.

synonyms.bx: 普通用词，主要指由于光线不足或缺乏照明而变得黑暗，使人看不见眼前物体，用于比喻时则指阴险的、邪恶的。

ex.enText: He likes to wear a black jacket.

ex.chText: 他发现了一个黑漆漆的山洞。

synonyms.bx: 主要指颜色是黑色的，有时也指某处因光线不足而黑暗的。

ex.chText: 你最好不要在那个昏暗的房间里看书。
ex.enText: You'd better not read in that dim room.

ex.chText: 他对童年的记忆有些模糊不清了。
ex.enText: He has a dim memory of his childhood.

synonyms.bx: 强调由于黑暗或光线微弱而无法看清物体的；也可指记忆不清晰的。

ex.enText: He sat in a dusky corner.

ex.chText: 那是一个灰蒙蒙的冬日，经过一番长途跋涉，他终于回到家了。
ex.enText: It was a dusky winter day when he returned home after a long journey.

synonyms.bx: 强调光线不足或微弱的；也指黎明或傍晚时周围环境灰蒙蒙的。

ex.chText: 在昏暗的光线下我看不清房子的门牌号。
ex.enText: I couldn't make out the house number in the murky light.

ex.chText: 秘书仅提出了一个模糊的建议。
ex.enText: The secretary only put forward a murky suggestion.

synonyms.bx: 主要指由于烟、雾等而难以看清的，引申则指含糊难懂的。

data.enText: take a dim view of sb/sth

data.chText: 对…持不赞成（或怀疑）态度；对…没有好感
data.enText: to disapprove of sb/sth; to not have a good opinion of sb/sth

data.chText: 她对我的建议持否定态度。
data.enText: She took a dim view of my suggestion.

example: The distinction between the two theories blurred

tr: make dim by comparison or conceal

example: Time had dimmed the silver
the lights dimmed and the curtain rose

tr: switch (a car's headlights) from a higher to a lower beam

example: a dim light beside the bed
subdued lights and soft music
the dimmed houselights brought a hush of anticipation
dimmed headlights
we like dimmed lights when we have dinner
so dense he never understands anything I say to him
never met anyone quite so dim
although dull at classical learning, at mathematics he was uncommonly quick"- Thackera
dumb officials make some really dumb decisions
he was either normally stupid or being deliberately obtuse
worked with the slow students
a dim figure in the distance
only a faint recollection
shadowy figures in the gloom
saw a vague outline of a building through the fog
a few wispy memories of childhood
the future looked black
prospects were bleak
Life in the Aran Islands has always been bleak and difficult"- J.M.Syng
took a dim view of things

example.ex: She stood waiting, in the dim light...
example.tran: 她站在昏暗的光线下等待。

example.ex: Below decks, the lights were dim.
example.tran: 船舱里灯光昏暗。

example.ex: Two lamps burned dimly...
example.tran: 两盏灯发出微弱的光。

example.ex: He followed her into a dimly lit kitchen.
example.tran: 他跟着她走进光线暗淡的厨房。

example.ex: ...the dimness of an early September evening.
example.tran: 9 月初傍晚的昏暗

value.def: A dim place is rather dark because there is not much light in it.

example.ex: The room was dim and cool and quiet.
example.tran: 房间里阴暗、清冷，静悄悄的。

example.ex: I squinted to adjust my eyes to the dimness.
example.tran: 我眯起眼，努力适应黑暗的环境。

value.def: A dim figure or object is not very easy to see, either because it is in shadow or darkness, or because it is far away.

example.ex: Pete's torch picked out the dim figures of Bob and Chang.
example.tran: 皮特的火把映出了鲍勃和张的模糊身影。

value.tran: (人影、物体)隐约的，蒙眬的，不分明的

example.ex: The shoreline could be dimly seen.
example.tran: 海岸线隐约可见。

value.def: If you have a dim memory or understanding of something, it is difficult to remember or is unclear in your mind.

example.ex: It seems that the '60s era of social activism is all but a dim memory.
example.tran: 20 世纪 60 年代的社会激进主义似乎只是一个模糊的记忆。

value.tran: (记忆、理解)模糊的，依稀的，不清晰的

example.ex: Christina dimly recalled the procedure...
example.tran: 克里斯蒂娜只依稀记得整个步骤。

example.ex: I was dimly aware that dozens of curious people were looking at us.
example.tran: 我迷迷糊糊地感觉到有数十个人在好奇地看着我们。

value.def: If the future of something is dim, you have no reason to feel hopeful or positive about it.

example.ex: The prospects for a peaceful solution are dim.
example.tran: 和平解决的希望非常渺茫。

value.tran: (前景)灰暗的，渺茫的，不光明的

value.def: If you describe someone as dim, you think that they are stupid.
If you dim a light or if it dims, it becomes less bright.

example.ex: Dim the lighting – it is unpleasant to lie with a bright light shining in your eyes...
example.tran: 把灯光调暗一些——躺着时眼前灯光太强很不舒服。

example.ex: The houselights dimmed.
example.tran: 观众席的灯暗了下来。

value.def: If you are driving a car and dim the headlights, you operate a switch that makes them shine downwards, so that they do not shine directly into the eyes of other drivers.

example.ex: Dim your lights behind that car.
example.tran: 开到那辆车后面时将前灯调为近光。

value.tran: 将(汽车前灯)调为近光;使减光

value.boxr_value: in BRIT, use 英国英语用 dip

value.def: If your future, hopes, or emotions dim or if something dims them, they become less good or less strong.

example.ex: Their economic prospects have dimmed...
example.tran: 他们的经济前景变得很暗淡。

example.ex: Forty eight years of marriage have not dimmed the passion between Bill and Helen.
example.tran: 48 年的婚姻生活并没消磨掉比尔和海伦之间的激情。

value.tran: (使)(前景、希望等)变渺茫;(使)（感情等）淡化

value.def: If your eyes dim or are dimmed by something, they become weaker or unable to see clearly.

example.ex: Her eyes dimmed with sorrow...
example.tran: 悲痛之下，她泪眼蒙眬。

example.ex: The twinkle in his eyes was dimmed by tears.
example.tran: 他眼中闪烁的光芒被泪水模糊了。

value.def: If your memories dim or if something dims them, they become less clear in your mind.

example.ex: Their memory of what happened has dimmed...
example.tran: 他们对所发生事情的记忆变得模糊了。

example.ex: The intervening years had dimmed his memory.
example.tran: 经过了其间那么多年他的记忆已经不大清楚了。

value.tran: (使)(记忆)变模糊;(使)变得不清晰
